reviewText: Well...I'm a boxing fan, and this gem I think went under the wire and did not get the acclaim it deserved it is just as good as Cinderella man and just as good as Raging Bull and as a Fan of Boxing I am glad to at it to my collection of great Boxing films two thumbs way up .
summary: A great under rated boxing film...Dempsey .

reviewText: This is a made-for-TV movie (1983) starring Treat Williams as the Manassa Mauler, Jack Dempsey.  It is very well done, both artistically and historically.  I was quite impressed with the historical accuracy of Dempsey's life, and absolutely floored by the reenactment of Dempsey's fights, all of which are fantastic reproductions of the actual fights.  Believe me, I have seen Dempsey's major fights, and the fight scenes in this movie are incredibly accurate and realistic.Dempsey's life was a tempestuous one.  Hailing from Colorado, Dempsey scratched and clawed and punched his way through bar fights, and pick-up fights until he got noticed by "Doc" Kearns, who guided Dempsey to the heavyweight championship in 1919. Along the way, Dempsey marries a hooker old enough to be his mother, manages not to get drafted into world war 2, and then once famous, marries a Hollywood actress and lives the high life. His two famous fights with Gene Tunney are accurately depicted, including the infamous "Long Count" match of 1927, where Dempsey failed to go to a neutral corner after flooring Tunney, and lost 4 precious seconds off the 10 count.Although a savage fighter inside the ring, Dempsey was was known as a warm, kind, caring, and generous person outside of boxing, and this film brings out these qualities.Well-acted, well-directed, and a compelling, interesting story make this film a winner.kone
summary: For a Made for TV Movie, Dempsey is a Winner
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am not a big fan of Treat Williams or of "Made For TV Movies" especially in the 1980s where production values were usually and noticeably quite bad.HOWEVER, I was pleasantly shocked and surprised at this movie!!!  Treat Williams was terrific and the production values were first rate.  Instead of a 90 minute cut and condensed to make room for commercials movie, this must have been shown over 2 nights as the movie is nearly 2 1/2 hours long, lovingly made and crafted and attention to detail is clearly shown throughout.The cast is first rate: Sally Kellerman as Dempsey's first wife, Sam Waterston as "Doc" Kearns, Peter Mark Richman as "Tex" Rickard and Victoria Tennant as Dempsey's second wife Estelle Taylor.The movie only goes up to the two fights with Gene Tunney (whom someone should make a movie of him too!!!)which is 1926-27.If you are a boxing fan to any degree, I highly recommend you purchase this DVD.  The price is dirt cheap and you won't be disappointed.I agree with the comments made here about the fight sequences:  They are quite good and considering they are in a made for tv movie, actually incredible.Buy this movie with both hands!!!!!!  :)
summary: much better movie than I expected
Title: N/A

reviewText: When Dempsey was released as a TV movie in 1983, it was presented at 2 hours 24 minutes (minus commercials).  Years later, the film was released on VHS with at least ten minutes cut and a sex scene inserted!  Well, it's 2005, and finally Dempsey is on DVD the way it was presented in its original cut.As far as the story, it follows all the major parts of his life pretty accurately.  Treat Williams is terrific as the Manassa Mauler.  Sam Waterston, in the role in which I always identify him, plays the perfect foxy Jack Kearns.The fight reinactments are just downright creepy, especially Dempsey's title-winning fight against Jess Willard.  If you ever see old films of the actual fight, and then watch this, you will literally be staring open-mouthed at the accuracy director Gus Trikonis applied, not just the settings but the casting as well.Boxing historians may point out a few glicks here and there.  However overall, this film has garnered praise from fight fans and non-fight fans alike.  There are no extra features on the DVD except for subtitles, but I can't complain.  I'm just happy to finally get it!
Title: N/A
